Class GameModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • GameModel

  • public class GameModel
extends java.lang.Object
    This class runs the logic and of the units on the board, from which the panel will draw info in what to put on the gui.
    Author:
    Garett Gritters

      • GameModel

        public GameModel(int row,
                 int col)
        Acts as the basic constructor for a character and will give the character's stats.
        Parameters:

        col - Constructor to create a clear game of size row by col

    • Method Detail

      • createPiece

        public void createPiece(int rowSpot,
                        int colSpot,
                        int moveSpeed,
                        int attackRange,
                        java.lang.String myName,
                        int isAlly)
        This method creates a unit in the game model
        Parameters:
        rowSpot - the spot in the item array.
        colSpot - the inventory you are looking in.
        moveSpeed - how many squares a unit can move
        attackRange - how far a unit can reach with their attack
        myName - the name of the unit
        isAlly - define if allied, enemy, or nothing. 1 is ally, 0 is nothing, -1 is enemy.

      • removePiece

        public void removePiece(int rowSpot,
                        int colSpot)
        This method removes a unit off of the model
        Parameters:
        rowSpot - row of unit to remove
        colSpot - column of unit to remove

      • canMovePiece

        public boolean canMovePiece(int fromRow,
                            int fromCol,
                            int toRow,
                            int toCol)
        This method check if the the piece on a spot (from) can move to a spot (to) Uses (row, col)
        Parameters:
        fromRow - the row of the unit trying to move
        fromCol - the column of the unit trying to move
        toRow - the row the unit is trying to move to
        toCol - the column the unit is trying to move to
        Returns:
        true if its a viable move, false if it isn't

      • isAlly

        public int isAlly(int rowSpot,
                  int colSpot)
        This method check the alliegance of a unit
        Parameters:
        rowSpot - the row of the unit
        colSpot - the col of the unit
        Returns:
        returns the alliegance of the spot. If 1, ally. If 0, nothing. If -1, enemy.

      • movePiece

        public void movePiece(int fromRow,
                      int fromCol,
                      int toRow,
                      int toCol)
        This method moves a unit from a spot to another spot.
        Parameters:
        fromRow - the row of the unit moving
        fromCol - the column of the unit moving
        toRow - the row the unit is moving to
        toCol - the column the unit is moving to
